newsitem.title: COTE D'IVOIRE: Ivorian cocoa processors take 122,000T by end June.
newsitem.headline: Ivorian cocoa processors take 122,000T by end June.

text.p: Ivorian cocoa processing factories took delivery of around 122,000 tonnes of cocoa up to the end of June compared to 114,800 in the same period in 1995/96, port sources said on Monday.
Deliveries averaged 13,500 tonnes per month in the first nine months of the 1996/97 season (Oct-Sept), against about 12,750 tonnes a month in the previous season, they added.

Processing capacity was raised by 21,500 tonnes in late 1996 to just over 160,000 tonnes and is set to rise further in 1997/98 as Ivory Coast encourages factory building as a way of adding export value.
Four factories owned by two processors are in operation and considering expansion for 1997/98. A fifth, with a bean capacity of 50,000 tonnes, is under construction.
Exporters said in July they expected total 1996/97 deliveries to be around 145,000 tonnes, below total grinding capacity.
Deliveries for each month (approximate figures) were:
Deliveries in early July 1997 totalled about 4,600 tonnes.
